content.text: SEDERBAUM--Arthur D. died peacefully at his home in New York City on January 19, surrounded by his beloved wife, Jayne M. Kurzman, daughters, Rebecca and Elizabeth, son David and his wife, Phoenix, sister Caroline Sederbaum and stepchildren, Anthony and Pamela Rykowski. He is also survived by his father, William Sederbaum, of Jacksonville, Florida. A nationally respected trusts and estates attorney, an avid patron of the arts and devoted father and husband, his wisdom, generosity and sense of humor will be greatly missed. Visitation at Frank E. Campbell Funeral Chapel, 81st Street and Madison Avenue, Monday, January 22, 2-5pm and 7-9pm. Funeral at St. Paul's Chapel at Columbia University, 118th Street and Amsterdam Avenue, Tuesday, January 23, 10:30 am. In lieu of flowers, the family asks that donations be made to The Rockefeller University or Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center.
content.title: Paid Notice: Deaths   SEDERBAUM, ARTHUR D.

content.text: GEISLER--Enid (Friedman), on December 29, 2006. Beloved wife, devoted mother, grandmother and sister-inlaw. She is survived by her husband Mortimer Geisler and children, Iris Horowitz, Daniel Friedman, Steven, Warren, Edward and Jayne Geisler, son and daughters-inlaw, Steven Horowitz, Holly Friedman, Carla, Beverly, and Kathi Geisler, 11 grandchildren, Lee and Pamela Horowitz, Lindsay, Amanda and Paul L. Friedman, Seth, Joshua, Sarah, Julia, Andrew and Michelle Geisler, nieces, nephews, grandnieces and nephews and sister-in-law Harriet Ansell. She is also predeceased by her husband Lawrence Friedman, son Paul Richard Friedman and brother Leonard Ansell. Funeral on Wednesday, January 3, at 11:00am at Gutterman's, Woodbury, NY.
content.title: Paid Notice: Deaths   GEISLER, ENID (FRIEDMAN)

content.text: GRECO--Dr. Gabriel, 91, loving husband of Norma, he passed away on Friday, January 6, in his sleep after a lingering illness. He was a man of infinite wisdom, integrity and great dignity. He was a skilled ophthalmologist and had great compassion. He was on the staffs of Bellevue, Tish Hospital, St. Vincent and Cabrini. He was a warm, loving friend and will be missed by all. Besides his wife, he is survived by his two sisters, Marion Macina and Rosalie Pasquale, and nieces, nephews and cousins. Services will be held Monday & Tuesday at Chas Peter Nagel Funeral home in NYC. In lieu of flowers, contributions may be made to Diabetes Research Institute Foundation.  $(6$)GRECO--Gabriel J. M.D., beloved husband of Norma, devoted brother of Marion Macina and Rosalie Pasquale, survived by many nieces, nephews and many wonderful friends. Reposing at Chas. Peter Nagel Funeral Home, 352 E. 87 St. NYC, between 1st and 2nd Ave. Mass of Christian Bural. St Joseph's Church. 87 St between 1st and York. Wednesday 10AM. Entombment Nassau Knolls Cemetery. Visiting hours, Monday and Tuesday 2-5, 7-9pm.
content.title: Paid Notice: Deaths   GRECO, DR. GABRIEL

content.text: FISCH--Herbert J., M.D. The entire Peninsula Hospital Center family is deeply saddened by the passing of Dr. Herbert J. Retired for the past several years, Dr. Fisch will long be remembered for his professionalism and dedication to the Hospital Center's mission and will be missed by all. Joel A. Miele Sr. P.E. Fisch. We express our deepest sympathies to Peter and to all other members of the family.

content.text: FISCH--Herbert J., M.D., died January 3rd, 2007, after a courageous battle with melanoma. Survived by his beloved wife Elinor, proud and loving children Jonathan Fisch, Amy and Jacob Wasserman and Peter and Jill Fisch, and adoring grandchildren Sam, Jessica, Ben, Emily, Daniel, Zach, Sara and Matthew. Outstanding physician for 46 years, 27 years as the Chief of Anesthesiology at Peninsula Hospital Center, President of the New York State Society of Anesthesiologists in 1992. World War II Navy Veteran. Scholar, a man of great integrity, photographer, historian and model shipbuilder. He will always be with us.  FISCH--Dr. Herbert. The partners, counsel, associates and staff of the firm of Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton & Garrison LLP express profound sorrow at the death on January 3rd of Dr. Herbert Fisch, beloved father of our friend and partner, Peter E. Fisch. We express our deepest sympathies to Peter and to all other members of the family.
content.title: Paid Notice: Deaths   FISCH, HERBERT J., M.D.

content.text: BLUMENTHAL--Martin. The Bezalel Academy of Arts and Design, Jeruselum, and Board of Governers mourn the passing of a dear friend and devoted patron. Leni May, Chairman Barry Alperin, President Joan Rosenbaum, Director $(6$)BLUMENTHAL--Martin The Friends of Bezalel Academy of Arts and Design, Jerusalem, wishes to convey deepest condolences to our devoted Board Member, Sallie Blumenthal, and to the rest of the family of our esteemed Chairman Emeritus, Martin Blumenthal, who has so generously supported the Academy through all the years of our existence. Goodkin, Vice President E. Billi Ivry, Vice President Lauren Presser, Vice President Barbara Zimet, Vice President Bathsheva Rifkin, Secretary/Treasurer $(6$)BLUMENTHAL--Martin. content.text: HIDARY--Mariel. We extend our heartfelt condolences to David and Aimee, and to the entire family. May they becomforted along with the mourners of Zion and Jerusalem. Morris W. Offit, President Susan K. content.text: ROSENFIELD--Helen Anna, of Brooklyn, New York, died peacefully on Sunday, January 7, 2007 at the age of 95 . She was predeceased by her husband Harry in 1969. She is survived by her son Stephen Rosenfield and his wife Riva Rosenfield, her daughter Mimi Meyers and husband, Gary Mangus, her four grandchildren, Peter Rosenfield, Jonathan Rosenfield, Joan Meyers, and Gregory Meyers, and her two greatgrandchildren, Hannah Rosenfield and Jessie Rosenfield. Funeral services will be held at 12 pm on Wednesday, January 10, 2007 at the Weinstein - Garlick - Kirshenbau Chapels, 1153 Coney Island Ave., Brooklyn, NY, 11230. Active in progressive political causes, Helen was a spirited and compassionate woman who will be missed by her family and friends. In lieu of flowers, contributions may be made to the ACLU Foundation, 125 Broad Street, New York, NY, 10004.

content.text: GREENBERG--Adolph loving and beloved husband of Joan. Devoted father, grandfather, and great-grandfather, dear brother. Services ''BoulevardRiverside'', 1450 Broadway, Hewlett LI, 12 noon Friday.  $(6$)GREENBERG--Adolph. The Officers, Board and Congregants of Temple Emanu-El of Lynbrook record with great sorrow the death of our beloved past President. We extend heartfelt condolences to Joan and his family. Bruce Kerner, President Rabbi Scott Corngold
content.title: Paid Notice: Deaths   GREENBERG, ADOLPH
